paper_abstract: The alternating group graph has been used as the underlying topology for many practical multicomputers, and has been extensively studied in the past. In this article, we will show that any alternating group graph AG(n), where n >= 3 is an integer, contains 2n - 4 mutually independent Hamiltonian cycles. More specifically, let N = vertical bar V(AG(n))vertical bar, v(i). is an element of V (AG(n)) for 1 <= i <= N, and < v(1), v(2), ... , v(N), v(1)> be a Hamiltonian cycle of AG(n). We show that AG(n) contains 2n - 4 Hamiltonian cycles, denoted by C-l = < v(1), v(2)(l), ... , v(N)(l), v(1)> for 1 <= l <= 2n - 4, such that v(i)(l) not equal v(i)(l) for all 2 <= i <= N whenever l not equal l'. The result is optimal since each vertex of AG(n) has exactly 2n - 4 neighbors.
paper_title: Mutually independent Hamiltonian cycles in alternating group graphs
